comment: Class consisted of straight lecture, attendance was not mandatory but highly recommended. You only have weekly homework assignments, 4 tests, and he final exam (It is important you do well on the tests). Most likely will have to take the class again.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: If you're a student who benefits from clear, structured lectures, you might find his teaching style not for you. But if you take the time to engage with him outside of class, you'll see how much he truly cares and how willing he is to invest in your success. He might not articulate everything perfectly during lectures, but he is dedication.

He offers lectures through zoom, so you don't have to attend the actual lecture. It was a bit hard to understand some things he would explain. I ended up teaching myself throughout the whole semester. He was an ok professor though. All tests were multiple choice.

2800 NOT 1211: Class is hard regardless of who teaches it, but this professor is just iffy for me. Nice guy, but only reads off powerpoints and not really a clear direction on what to study. He gives practice tests, but are only slightly helpful for exams. He does however, curve the tests like crazy. It's probably the only reason I managed to pass.

This class is hard regardless of who teaches it, but this professor is just iffy for me. Nice guy, but only reads off powerpoints and not really a clear direction on what to study. He gives practice tests, but are only slightly helpful for exams. He does however, curve the tests like crazy. It's probably the only reason I managed to pass.

He is lecture heavy and does use a lot of PowerPoints but he barely teaches (uses PowerPoints)! I found it a bit difficult to keep up with everything as he would rush with every topic. Very nice guy, not so much a great teacher.

Language barrier perhaps? The LAs can explain everything better than he can. He sort of brushes you off when you confront him about the ridiculous lack of organization in the class. We never knew when an assignment is due. He is a lot easier to get an A though than other professors because he is understanding and lenient. However, you won't learn.

I took him for 1212 and failed him. The reason I signed up for his class again is because he was teaching the only section. I attend every lecture and attempt to take notes, but he moves through material so fast. If there is a day that lecture gets cancled leading up to an exam, he just sends out a video and you are still expected to take the exam.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He rushes through lectures and practice problems. If you are someone that learns by application, you will not be able to understand anything in his lectures. Finally, on top of trying to teach yourself the material, there is so much HW.

His course & instruction have been pretty frustrating. He rushes through slides and both tests have been over 10% of the lectured material. As in, 90% of what was taught across lecture was not on the exams. Essentially, it's a total gamble on what material will actually be on the tests, because he also doesn't provide a clue to what that could be.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: He sped through lectures. We went through 15-20 slides in 55 minutes. Be ready to read the textbook to teach yourself or stay ahead and form a study group.
DON'T TAKE HIM!!! SAVE YOURSELF HE'S TERRIBLE
he doesnt do a good job at explaining anything and moves way to fast dont take this class unless you already know chemistry because you will be teaching yourself the whole semester

Jia is a genuinely nice guy, however he does not know how to prepare you for exams. There would be times in this class where we were an entire unit ahed and he would not slow down despite student concerns and there were also times where he would finish teaching the unit the day before the test. Majority of students got c, d and f on all his exams.

Professor Jia is best at explaining the math, you won't be lost. The concepts are hard to grasp and his English isn't the best. He goes very fast, you cannot miss class. Practice test/weekly homework helpful. He is very caring, opened up any hw that was below a 90, respond to emails fast. No test curve. Outside work is required.

He cares and wants you to do well, but he is hard to follow. Examples are not clear and he goes very fast. He will slow down if you ask. Test heavy, helpful homework online. Go to SI sessions. Test grades are replaced by the final.

You may have to teach yourself a lot of the content in this class. I found it hard to follow him in a lot of his lectures due to his accent. Though that was out of his control and he tries his best. I would just say maybe not the best professor to take if chem isn't your strong suit.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: You can tell he really loves what he does. Whenever even one person seems confused, he will slow down and explain what he was talking about again. He also records every lecture on zoom and posts it so you can watch it if you missed the lecture. There is a weekly homework assignment but it is never too hard. The class is easy with moderate effort.

Dr. Jia is a good professor, his lectures were informative, but he didnt explain the content as clear as some would have liked. You WILL have to put in the effort to understand and practice the material outside of class. He is a very caring and helpful professor, he'll help and answer any Q's or misunderstandings you have. His exams are easy!

a really nice professor and is always encouraging to students. But He reads from PowerPoints he has not made with several typos. Exams given are also not his and even had to give everyone 8 points back on exam 3 because there were so many typos. Final exam was an ACS exam and was nothing like our others. You will have to teach yourself.

Dr. Jia is a great professor and wants all of his students to succeed. We have 4 tests, 1 final, and 15 homework assignments (one per week). The tests were fairly similar to the practice tests and the homework assignments had 10 attempts on each question and we will reopen them at the end of the semester. The final is through ACS. Would take again!

He's okay. If you're not good at self-studying, then steer clear, because he isn't the best teacher and you'll have to spend a lot of time studying on your own. He just has weekly homework and four tests, and the tests weren't so bad. However, I'm rating him a 2 because although he's a nice guy, his last two tests have had mistakes in the grading.

Dr. Jia is a caring teacher but it is hard to follow his lectures. He is harder than the other teachers when taking tests. Other chem classes were allowed a reference sheet for tests or they got curves, don't expect that in his class. Grading= 4 tests homework & 1 final. (test heavy) . Our last quarter test occured 1 week b4 final.

He is a very nice professor, however, his accent is extremely thick so for the most part I couldn't understand what he was teaching. You will have to rely heavily on the online reading for this class. His pretests also do not cover what is on the test at all.

Goes extremely fast even when students are not clear on what hes teaching. At one point he was literally 3 weeks ahed of schedule and started teaching the next unit when we had not taken the previous test yet. I would not recommend.

The man is amazing and so supportive. I DO NOT recommend taking it over the summer bc it is alot to process and hard to memorize all essential formulas. But as an individual this guy is great and will go out of his way to help you.

Homework every week with unlimited attempts, four tests in which he gave us two attempts(understand chemistry is a hard class), and a final. He did both in-class and online options. Always their to answer questions and tends to be very fast responding to emails. He is a very nice and understanding person who is there to help see students succeed.

He was a great teacher but I found some parts of his lectures confusing and had to look at the textbook frequently. Other than that he was wonderful, he answers any questions and the homework isn't too much. Study for the exams and you should pass easy.

He is a great professor and really care if you need help or not always checks on us to make sure we don't have questions. Very understanding he knows that chemistry can be a difficult topic to learn and does the best to provide us with help if needed. about 10 homework assignments, 4 exams, and the acs final. Use his study guides for exams.

He is incredibly caring and wants you to succeed but his lectures are rather passionless. It's also hard to keep up with the math portions as he has sloppy handwriting and his work is all over the place. A plus is he gives two attempts for exams and the homework is far harder than the exam.

I took his lab and cant say anything for the lecture, but he is probably one of the easiest lab professors to take. No unnecessary work, no strict grading, and slightly lenient on late work. Literally just get whatever experimental measurements you need to write down for the day in the workbook and you can leave to do the rest at home. Great guy.
Dr. Jia is an amazing professor! His lectures are very interesting, and he always helps me whenever I email him about any issues. He is truly an amazing man.

I really wish RateMyProfessor has no word limitation because I would say Dr. Jia is the best professor I have ever had. There is so much I want to say above 350 characters. He is very caring and really wants the best for all his students. He answered all my questions and always responds to emails. Take his class; you won't regret it.

Dr. Jia is the best professor I have ever had. If you are thinking about taking his class, DON'T THINK, JUST TAKE IT! Do not listen to his old reviews because they are not accurate descriptions of him. He is a very caring professor and really wants his students to succeed. He always responds to emails very quickly and his lectures are amazing.

The lectures are boring and you basically have to teach yourself in this class but he as a person is very nice. If you miss a deadline you can email him or go to his office hours and he is more than willing to work with you. The content and class itself is difficult but the questions on the test are too hard. The practice tests helps with studying

Good for lab, but terrible for lecture. You would ask him questions on assignments and half the time he would not know how to do it. He read word for word off the powerpoint. The class had tons of hw. The only thing that will save your grade is the practice exams and hw. If you want to learn anything, do not take him.

Professor Jia is so kind. Hes always ready to help and Hes not strict/hard at all. I ended up missing a few homework assignments and after I emailed him about it, he ended up opening them back up for me. Just communicate about what you need. The class is hard in general, but he does what he can to make it easier and help your grade.

Dr. Jia's summer lectures gave me less than nothing. I never understood what he was talking about, EVER. The class was at 8 am online during the summer which didn't help. I learned absolutely NOTHING from this class. The nice thing though, was that his tests and practice tests were multiple attempts. Take him for the A but not if you want to learn.
